intro: Cyrtandra honokawaiensis, commonly known as the Honokawa cyrtandra, is a rare flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The plant is typically found growing in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. It has small, opposite leaves and produces fruit that contains several seeds. Due to its restricted habitat and threats from invasive species, it is considered endangered.
